I mostly recommend this due to the multiplayer. It is fast paced and fun to play. There are some weapons which if you practice will give you a lot of advantages such as the gauss gun. There is also huge mod support and a lot of mods available online for download. This game is also the reason other great games exist such as counter strike and team fortress.

Even after all these years still a great game, no complex skilltrees, just here's your gun go and shoot things.
Simple with a good story, the way it should be.

Other than it's graphics and physics, this games is anything but outdated. There is a great sense of 
 atmosphere and urgency as Black Mesa is plunged into chaos. Although the combat is subpar and most of Xen 
 isn't very fun, it's a classic nonetheless.
                                                                          4.7/5
Left it on for like 3 days, Class game though!

The original half life is much better In the fact that it is not Riddled with bugs the new version need major help.
The Game play is different in some areas ie you take a different route than the original but end up in same place It also seems a lot harder too as you get damaged even when your Far away. you get stuck in loading screens (literally) and have to relog. after freeman gets captured he looses all weapons, yes. however you do get them back. i encounter a bug where  once I regained my weapons (one by one) they would just disappear.  the AK stuck around thanks Gawd...but the rest i didn't get back till almost the end. At the place where they are all in that storage area. this made a hard game REALLY hard.  Try to beat a helicopter with just a crowbar....Yeah it was game breaking and had to stop.  Yes it has better Graphics that I can say. but for the rest, all I can say is it needs some tender loving care for sure.  They made the suit feel like your walking on ice all the time . didn't like it at all .  It's possible that I May change my review in the future. but it depends on the devs cause there is a lot of work that needs to be done. if you can Buy the original It's  a Great game or was.

Great game fininshed in 10 hours.. I really didn't like the middle but the beginning and the end were amazing, one of the best games I've ever played, rn I'm going to go play hl2, ep1 and ep2. 
then when my quest arrives in 2-3 weeks I'll play alyx as well!

Great game, revolutionary for its time. Playing it in 2020 its still fun. Valve is great at escape games like this and Portal. If you want the old school experience play this, otherwise get the Black Mesa remaster. Half Life 2 really steps it up.
A classic is always good to play.

Theres not much to say really.
I decided to play through every half life game with no mods for the first time in forever and I do own Half-Life source, but I mean come on its Half-life source. I tried not judging this game by its influence on the industry, but on the game itself. Lets be real, This game holds up well. Lets get the elephant out the room first though. Yes this game looks dated as hell, but it was also released in 1998 and by that time it looked fantastic, GoldSrc is a mix bag of an engine now mainly because source shits on it, but this game's graphics are excellent by the standards of the late 90s. The story is not quite there, but with good reason this was a rare opportunity for Valve and they didn't know yet that this game would get a sequel, But this game became the purest sample of world presented we had at the time. Never leaving Gordon's perspective it really felt like YOUR journey. Gameplay is obviously what we all care about and sure I don't think the games shooting is comparable to a game like DOOM or Quake, but I think where Half-Life shines is in its enemies and Weapon rosters which mashed together with great level layout makes Half-Life's shooting truly Unique and great.

9/10
"One of the most important shooters of all time, quite literally changed the game for the FPS genre"

I played this in 2020 and think the game has held up pretty well. Of course, the graphics are dated, but I can tell that they were good for their time. The gameplay and story are really good even compared to newer games. The story leaves a number of things unexplained but has just enough dialogue to explain why you are on your current mission. There were a few areas that frustrated me, but I felt really satisfied after I completed those areas. Overall, I would say this is a must play if you want to play older games.

Coming from someone who isn't a big fan of first-person shooters, I [b] loved [/b] this one!

It's easily one of the best of its kind. The story is well-crafted, and the "puzzling" gameplay is simply spectacular. I can now see why people call this revolutionary, because it certainly is! Back in '98, this must've been the shit. Don't get me wrong, it's far from perfect. The graphics are...heh, not great two decades later, and sometimes the game expects a little too much from you in terms of skill. But honestly, I thoroughly enjoyed the puzzles and their execution. They weren't too hard or challenging.

All in all, great game. It can get pretty frustrating though.

This game gets my subjective score of [b]8/10.[/b]
